2. Data, can you give some more detail about the different datasets and methods by which they are generated? It may be easier to use a table, for examples see www.kuleuven.be/english/research/associatienet/support/scholcomm/rdm/ku-leuven-example-dmps/example-dmps-from-ku-leuven-researchers
7. Sharing: Have you considered any specific repositories for sharing, for example those from EBI (www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/)? Journal publishers also give often good recommendations so its easiest to look in the data guidelines of the journals in which you may publish, if there are no suitable domain specific repositories you can use RDR: www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr.
